|death_date = |death_place = Athens, GreeceEncyclopædia Britannica: Georgios Papandreou Retrieved 30 June 2010 |spouse = Sofia Mineyko Cybele Andrianou |children = Andreas Papandreou Georgios G. Papandreou |nationality = Greek |party = Centre Union |signature = Georgios-papandreou-senior-signature.svg }} Georgios Papandreou ( Geórgios Papandréou; 13 February 1888 - 1 November 1968) was a Greek politician. He was the founder of the Papandreou political dynasty. He was Prime Minister of Greece (1944–1945, 1963, 1964–1965). He was also Deputy Prime Minister from 1950–1952, in the governments of Nikolaos Plastiras and Sofoklis Venizelos.David Wilsford, ed. Political leaders of contemporary Western Europe: a biographical dictionary (Greenwood, 1995) pp 368-75. ==References== Category:1888 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Greece
